page.title: 06FINZEAN BUILDINGS.
page.content: {Finzean Church,}built in 1865, holds about 130.Stone built, harled on the outside with a slated roof, it was restored and updated internally in 1965 by the estate ground officer, Sandy Cooper,skilled and sensitive craftsman. {Finzean Hall,}built for the community by Joseph Farquharson in 1926,is timber built with corrugated iron roof and recently reopened after extensive renovation by largely voluntary labour financed by local fund raising and Government grant.The main hall has a stage and is used for concerts,dances and playing badminton.The adjoining small hall is used for meetings and small functions. {Finzean Stores,}recently burnt down and being rebuilt with improvements, contains the local Post Office.
